body.p: The Problems view can be used to validate a publication or all publications defined in your DITA project. This provides a way to ensure that your project remains valid when you commit your changes. The validation process includes checking compliance with the DITA schema and ensuring that all links and key references are correctly resolved in your publications.

When you go to this page for the first time, there is a Validate now button that triggers the project validation. While the validation is processing, a message indicates the status. You can click the Stop button to terminate the process early.

Once the validation has processed, the Refresh in the top-right corner of the view triggers a new validation. The number of issues detected is displayed at the top of the page. If no problems are detected, a Restart validation button appears that also triggers a new validation.

If problems are detected, each one is listed with the type of problem displayed in a badge at the top-left corner of the problem, the name of the publication in the top-right corner, followed by a description of the problem. The file name is listed at the bottom of each problem and clicking on the file name opens it in the editor pane (if the file is from a different publication other than the current publication, a dialog box is displayed asking if you want to switch to the other publication).

If problems are detected, a drop-down also appears at the top of the view where you can select a particular publication defined in the project to validate a particular publication or you can select All publications to validate the entire project.
